description: The LS6-powered lightweight that taught European exotics a lesson in value. The C5 Z06 stripped weight everywhere — thinner glass, titanium exhaust, lighter wheels — and bolted in a 405 horsepower small-block V8 that redlines at 6500 RPM. The result embarrassed cars costing three times as much.
lore: The C5 Z06 is the blue-collar track weapon. No fancy electronics, no dual-clutch gearbox, no launch control. Just a big naturally aspirated V8, a six-speed manual, and a chassis that'll do whatever you have the courage to ask. The best bang-for-buck performance car ever built.
